greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0; for n > 1, a(n) = A010051(n) + 2*a(floor(n/2)).
comment: 1-bits in base-2 expansion of a(n) indicate the positions of primes in the sequence [n, floor(n/2), floor(n/4), ..., 1].
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
mathematica: a[1] = 0; a[n_] := a[n] = Boole[PrimeQ[n]] + 2*a[Floor[n/2]]; Array[a, 96] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 29 2017 *)
xref: Cf. also A292596 (variant for odd primes).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 27 2017
